Text:
Guys, I ask of you two things....

Please do seed.....

If you like this series,do buy them and show your tribute to the artist and writer for coming up with such a great series.....
Have a great time reading....

I'm really excited about Cinebook starting its publishing run of these series. They say they're going to eventually translate and release all 19 vols. in English.

Vol. 1 i.e. "The Day of the Black Sun" is already out (released in May 2010): http://www.cinebook.co.uk/catalogue~Cat~A-008-046B~Code~9781849180399.asp

Next up is "Where the Indian Walks" in July: http://www.cinebook.co.uk/catalogue~Cat~A-008-046B~Code~9781849180405.asp

And then "All the Tears of Hell" in Sept: http://www.cinebook.co.uk/catalogue~Cat~A-008-046B~Code~9781849180511.asp

So looks to be a regular bimonthly schedule as of now, which is great! :)

This is indeed a great serie. In French/Dutch they have more then enough to keep going for a while.

I love the books, and have them (in dutch), now I can show them to my friends here in Thailand

Thank you for the torrent

Now, if some of you donÂ´t know this and are used to viewing comics in .cbr or .cbz readers; this archived collection is no problem. You just rename the .rar files to .cbr and then you can view them in your Comic Book Viewer. Regards, Djofullinn.
Is there episode 18 and 19 translated to english floating around anywhere.  I loved this series so far and will be seeding it for a while, but I have to find the last to books or I'll go crazy.
I haven't come across the last two episodes. I assume they have not been translated yet. That might be due to the fact that Cine-book is releasing the entire series in English in a regular basis.
Yeah but, their regular basis is one issue every two months, so the last two won't be out for over a year or two.
Just came here to let you know guys that I saw the scans for the first four cinebook titles of XIII in net recently. Happy hunting.
